answers.answer: All these problems can be caused by irritation of the cranial nerves, from a viral infection, diabetes or shingles. Sometimes the exact cause is unknown.In general they disappear within thirty days. Sometimes they develop into what is called Bell's palsy.If they begin to worsen see a physician. Generally they prescribe short treatment with oral prednisone.
Is there any home remedies to try to improve this condition?

Have you been exposed to a draft or very cold wind blowing on your face, sitting in a car with a window open?Your condition may be neuralgia caused by the draught and cold wind.Never expose yourself to be in a through draft.If you have neuralgia, this will get better on its own by keeping warm and out of draughts.Numbness and tingling throughout parts of your face may be migrainal.  Take pain relief medication as prescribed on the packet.Foods that trigger off migraines are oranges, chocolate, cheese, red wine.  You may have different food triggers.  Stress can cause migraines in some people.  A lot of computer work can also cause migraines.With Bell's Palsy, you would feel temporary weakness or paralysis which could cause drooping of your facial muscles.  This can affect the eyelid and the mouth.If you notice that you are experiencing weak paralysis, book an appointment to see your doctor.
In general a mild anti-inflammatory such as Motrin, should help.

question: For the last two to three days, I've been felling numbness and tingling throughout parts of my face. I've also done some research online, and it seems to to be that it's something less significant than facial paralysis.. I have no pain, but I do have some twitching in my left eye. What is it exactly that causes
title: I have facial numbness and tingling
